text: soviet hassan could wipe off the face of
the earth i stay and we put the whole
world could be blown to pieces any
minute my darling jenya she's right it
is getting serious directed by Sally
Potter ginger and Rosa is a
coming-of-age story about to close
friends in 1962 London in his review AO
scott reitz ginger and rosa is more
conventional than some of Miss Potter's
other films her impeccable sense of
color and composition and her use of
montage and careful sound design as a
kind of emotional shorthand are used
here in the service of novelistic
psychological realism nearly everything
in the film has the ring of truth in no
small part because of the two remarkable
young actresses in its title roles elle
fanning shows a nearly Streep Ian
mixture of poise intensity and technical
precision Rosa is mostly seen through
gingers eyes her motives are not always
clear to her in alice englert is as
adept at blurring roses feelings as Miss
Fanning is at clarifying gingers between
them they illuminate an intimate
volatile cosmos what really matters is
to live
and if we do I will be nothing to
forgive
